str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To fall upon, press upon, light upon, come over. From epi and pipto; to embrace or seize.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
